review_blob: Sweet and honeyish aroma with apple and cinnamon flavour medley. A little cidery for my liking.
As usual superstition delivers a punchy liquor ending. The pear is not prevalent over the honey, but still a nice touch. The honey sweetness lingers on the tongue to mellow the sour tart aftertaste.
A bit floral but mostly apple. Standard carbonation mellows the earthy tones. A little sticky sweet, but mostly standard cider.
Drinkable but not ideal. Very sweet appley, nearly dry finish. A little normal boring.

Very deep colour stood out not only on the shelf but once poured.

Gave mead a go instead of a cider and was not disappointed.

The cherry scent is potent, wafts quickly out of the glass. More tart and dry than expected, but still comfortable sweet.

Rests softly on the tongue with a lingering aftertaste. 

Enjoyed a full glass of this but capped to drink later - easy to drink, but a small batch that could run out quickly!
beer_name: Mabinogion Mead - Pollination Series Batch 002 Cherry Cyser

review_blob: Incredibly bright red in colour, surprised by how grape it wafts. Overall good and so very berry. Not sicky sweet with a tart and slightly sour finish.

So dry this cider is sharp. Very apple with a surprisingly golden/range colour.
Apple flavour is rich hinting of earthy minerals, but too dry to drink often.
